metadata.title: CVE-2015-0804 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The HTMLSourceElement::BindToTree function in Mozilla Firefox before 37.0does not properly constrain a data type after omitting namespace validationduring certain tree-binding operations, which allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (use-after-free) via acrafted HTML document containing a SOURCE element.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0804` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '37.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
